name: Sanitation Struggles
title: Rural Sanitation Services Lagging
description: In 2022, only 1.23% of North Korea's rural population had access to safely managed sanitation services, highlighting significant challenges in rural infrastructure.

name: Women in Workforce
title: High Female Labor Force Participation
description: In 2024, 86.98% of women aged 15-64 were part of the labor force, showcasing strong female workforce engagement in North Korea.

name: Import Reliance
title: Dependence on Regional Imports
description: In 2023, 97.10% of North Korea's merchandise imports came from low- and middle-income economies within East Asia & Pacific, indicating a heavy reliance on regional trade partners.

name: Immunization Gaps
title: Low Child Immunization Rates
description: In 2023, only 16% of one-year-old children received the HepB3 vaccine, and the same percentage of children aged 12-23 months received the DPT vaccine, pointing to significant public health challenges.

name: Data Dilemma
title: Poor Data Utilization
description: North Korea scored a mere 10 out of 100 in the Statistical Performance Indicators for data use in 2023, reflecting significant challenges in data management and utilization.

name: Regulatory Challenges
title: Low Regulatory Quality
description: In 2023, North Korea's regulatory quality was estimated at -2.39, indicating significant challenges in creating and enforcing effective regulations.

name: Environmental Efforts
title: Significant Reduction in N2O Emissions
description: Since 1990, North Korea has reduced its nitrous oxide emissions by 67.13%, showcasing a significant environmental effort.

name: Voice Constraints
title: Limited Voice and Accountability
description: In 2023, North Korea's voice and accountability estimate was -1.98, reflecting limited political freedoms and citizen participation.
